
***
*Solution:*
If $x \in [-1,1]$ then clearly $z \in [0,1]$.
If $X \sim \text{U}(-1,1)$ then the CDF is $P(X < x) = (x + 1)/2$ for $x \in [0,1]$.
The CDF for $Z$ can be written as 
$$
\begin{aligned}
P(Z < z) = P(X^2 < z) & = P(- \sqrt{z} < X < \sqrt{z}) \\
& = P( X < \sqrt{z} ) - P(X < - \sqrt{z}) \\
& =  (\sqrt{z} + 1)/2 - (-\sqrt{z} + 1)/2 \\
& = \sqrt{z} \quad \text{for} \quad z \in [0,1]
\end{aligned}
$$
The pdf for $Z$ is therefore $\frac{\partial}{\partial z} P(Z < z) = \frac{z^{-1/2}}{2}$ for $z \in [0,1]$. This is a $\text{Beta}(1/2,1)$ distribution.
